Hello list,

I've to crawl extranet sites without public DNS. I can browse =
them using a proxy. The proxy can resolve their domain names with its own l=
ocal dns server, but I couldn't by myself. So it's possible to browse them =
with a proxy-configured browser, even if my host couldn't resolve their dom=
ainnames.

I used the http-proxy option in heritrix, but it fails. The fron=
tier logs show me that Heritrix is trying to dns-resolve the domains. I tri=
ed to remove the FetchDNS fetcher, but then heritrix complains about a wron=
g profile and I couldn't create a job.

Finally, I've got this configuratio=
n :
a fetcher.FetchDNS with a AcceptDecideRule in it,
and I have accept-non=
-dns-resolves set to true

Heritrix continues to hang on DNS request (reque=
sts in snooze and long queues), unless I put the domainnames in /etc/hosts.=
 Then it will correctly crawl the domains in /etc/hosts, and ignore the oth=
ers.

Is there a way to tell heritrix to not use the DNS/resolver at all ?
